SENT.plain: Pseudotumour cerebri is a clinical syndrome characterized by increased intracranial pressure in the absence of intracranial pathology
The possible association between this condition and infections has already been mention in a few case series
This paper describes a 6-y-old girl with a classical picture of pseudotumour cerebri: which developed 1 week following varicella
To the authors' knowledge, this is the first description suggesting this association
Additional reports are required to support the possible relationship between the two conditions
